author: Special Correspondent
text:
Entries have been invited for The Hindu Young World Painting Competition 2016, organised in association with Thyrocare, for schoolchildren from classes 4 to 9.

The competition will be held under two categories – juniors (class to 6) and seniors (class 7 to 9). Children have to register online to generate a unique ID, which should be written on the top of the drawing. The art work should be certified as original either by the head of the institution or the art teacher. The entries, with the unique ID and attestation, should be sent for preliminary selection.

Students should choose any one of the given topics and draw the painting on a white drawing sheet (size 26 cm X 27 cm) and forward it for preliminary selection. Children should write their name, class, school, residential address, mobile number, and e-mail id on the backside of the drawing sheet.

Topics for juniors (class 4 to 6) are: At the toy/pet store, Gully cricket, Sunday family picnic, Cleaning my street,

A day at the zoo, At the circus, Water birds, Scenes from a village, First visit to the public library, and Summer activities.

Topics for seniors (Class 7 to 9) are: Beach clean-up, Camping out, New year carnival, Classical/rock music concert, Book fair,

Underwater life, Portraits of emotions, If dinosaurs existed today, Domesticating the wild, Retelling your favourite fairy tale and Life without technology.

Students selected for the finals, dates for which will be announced later, will be intimated individually and they should report at the venue with the intimation letter. Topics will be given on-the-spot for the finals and prizes to the winners will be distributed in the afternoon. Last date for receipt of entries is March 6.

For registration and other details, students have to log on to: www.thehindu.com/ywpainting where they can get their unique ID.

Entries should be sent to The Hindu , Circulation Department, Chennai By-pass Road, Senthaneerpuram, Tiruchi-620004. More details can be had from K. Chandrasekaran by dialling 0431-2302801 or 9443361290.
